headline: Neutral working experience in Talabat
pros: Like any other tech firms, talabat has a good business model
cons:
- The company is not diversified anymore and most of the jobs rotation and promotions have become friendship-based not qualifications/competence-based
- Bad environment to support your career growth according to the minimal amount of learning opportunities that you will have and the generalized/unpersonalized feedback that you get from your managers 
- Disengagement and low rate of employees experience: the company cares more about the traditional engagement activities rather than solving the employees' problems which sequential will make them more engaged

headline: Great company to work for.
pros: Good insurance, great office space, good benefits, great work culture and diversity in the regional team. Good work life balance if you can manage it. Flexible remote working options, sabbatical options to study, etc.
cons: Visa category can be heavily affected based on attestation of degree certificates.

headline: A great tech place to work, grow, and be part of something amazing
pros:
The best thing about working at talabat is the environment. You have the opportunity to work on a product that has millions of daily users. You are part of something where you can make an impact either on improving the performance, the experience, the ways of working anything.

We work as empowered teams, and we as a team decide what we build and to run those services in production following 'you build it, you run it'.

There are a lot of experienced engineers to learn from, and they share their knowledge through chapter meetings, or knowledge sharing sessions, coaching, and improvement katas. 

The team of over 200+ engineers brings so much diversity in experience, ways of working and different approaches. This allows us to expand our thinking and learn different ways of solving the same problems. Although sometimes differences of opinion do occur, however it is done with the best intentions.

Our goals are very clear, and we are involved in setting them and defining the criteria for success.

The technology stack is very modern, and it constantly improving to make the engineering teams live easy so they can keep the flow of features. There is some legacy, but we are constantly 

Overall, it's a great place to work, especially for the region it is very advanced in its maturity and would recommend to anyone to join.
cons: Being part of a big team, can sometimes be difficult to see the big picture, or to find the right person to help. But usually, there is someone who can and will help you, it just takes a little bit of persistence to find them.

headline: Honest Review
pros:
Pros of working in Talabat is that you will be able to work casually , work related and also in the environment. This will give a lot of leeway in order for you to be who you are. 

With that being said growth and opportunities are on going in Talabat therefore this organization youthful and will continue growing due to it's environment and culture.
cons: Downside is Talabat is the fastest growing food industry, therefore if you're not willing to work and grow Talabat might not be the right organization which you are seeking for.

headline: Great culture

headline: WORT COMPANY CULTURE & MANAGEMENT
pros:
-Very laidback
-No pressure 
-Come & go as you please

A great experience to learn exactly what a corrupt, toxic organization really is.
cons: Work culture is extremely toxic(Mainly built on gossip), management is an absolute joke. Everyone that’s in management positions are there because of who they are friends with. No talent or expertise to deliver on tangibles. Sales team forges trade licenses to onboard restaurants & gets paid off the books by restaurants for special treatments. Let’s not even talk about the Software development team that require months to deliver on a simple tweak to the app. Logistics is an absolute disaster, no visibility or guidance over the team to coordinate efficiently. Marketing team; Any one living in the UAE would know how shameful it is. There’s absolutely no synergy or alignment internally on any objective. Join Talabat if you’re a good at sucking up to other people and have no experience in any domain. You’ll definitely climb the ladder quick with minimal effort.

headline: Working at Talabat
pros:
- the strongest Tech/Product company in the Middle East
- incredible pace of growth
- extremely international environment
- cool product
- very friendly environment 
- your got to have a lot of autonomy 
- good market salary for support functions but higher than the market for Tech and Product
- good learning curve
- amazing office
cons:
- since the growth is extreme, some processes sometimes become messy, unstructured and with this growth small bureaucracy appears. 
- people are loaded with work because of the massive growth - but Talabat is aware of it and hiring hundreds of people every year to reduce the workload from the employees. So I would say it is only partly a cons because they are working on the solution.

headline: Awesome Team and Great Environment
pros: Since the first interactions with the talent acquisition, it has been extremely professional. Everyone shares a culture of openness and inclusiveness, interviews are delightful, and the onboarding is smooth. Speaking about my team, in this high growth environment, I felt cooperation from all team members with the goal of getting me onboard being patient with my learning curve. The empowerment is there; doors are always open; everyone is helpful. I have also found my team to be one of the greatest talents in the region, honored to associate.
cons: Post-covid, the majority of my team are working remotely. This is my first time onboarding remotely. I have to say, not specific to Talabat, but in general, I would have loved if my first month was with everyone in the office, just for the vibe and fun of it.

headline: What an awesome team!
pros:
1. Smooth and pro-active interview journey - both in giving timely feedback and updates. Also setting practical scenarios and questions for interviewees to really add value and give their input on on-ground problems.
2. A thorough onboarding process getting you quickly up to speed with how each cog in the machine works and functions. Also insightful one-on-one sessions with key stakeholders.
3. Super culture and flexible work ethic - just get the job done.
cons: - An extremely fast paced environment - not necessarily a con for alot of folks but a challenge for those coming from different industries. You're expected to deliver as soon as you're part of the group hence you need to catch the train as soon as possible.

headline: Sales Admin
pros: It was a really fun environment, there was a lot of potentials to grow but it all depends on who your manager is. The benefits are great, we eat breakfast sometimes, go out for lunch, and great healthcare
cons: Your growth depends on who your manager is and if HR really cares. Though they do have some values they pretend to care about, it all depends on the local level how its implemented. There are unseen discrimination and biases against women and a lot of times it felt like a boys club, due to the lack of female managers. They are headed towards a different direction, where they hired a female MD in Jordan. But still, so much work to be done.  There is no work-life balance as well

headline: Best Place to Work
pros:
Talabat has a mission and vision, which is very clear. Thus, individual goals are very transparent. It is a performance-driven company that provides yearly increment based on performance.
There is an excellent opportunity for career development.
It has a great culture, strong values, and an inclusive work environment.
cons: Placing a bonus system for the support group would be ideal.

Fast paced environment which keeps you stimulated
cons: Fast paced environment is not for everyone

headline: Where everyone wants to be part in Qatar

talabat has a very strong impact with several in the Country and that is really appreciated.
cons: Time management. To ensure I take my role on time. talabat provided me great training on that and was useful.

headline: The best place I have worked

headline: Incredible Environment
pros:
I've been working with Talabat for a year now, one of the most exciting challenges I've had the opportunity to be a part of. So many amazing changes, new growth prospects and a strong supportive leadership team.

- Amazing environment.
- Lots of opportunity for growth.
- Culturally diverse.
- Fast paced.
- Well rewarded (salary/benefits)
cons: No real cons, you have to be ready for a super fast paced challenge to come in and make things happen!

headline: Big Name but useless
pros:
Delivery hero owning Talabat is a big Pro, 
Delivery Hero has streamlined many things in the company with a brand new leaderships and vision. But the old horses in the company are ruining it with their age old mindset. The managers here have reached there by luck and lack vision and leadership skills. Most of them are kiddish in their behaviour and treats their team as workhorses. No empathy no worklife.
cons:
Poor work-life balance
Long working hours.
In human managers.
Un realistic about expectations.
No personal growth or learning
Still relying on waterfall type development and citing it as agile practice.

headline: Disappointed

headline: Not the best

cons: Challenges face include pressure from customers, language (Most customers don't understand English language so it was difficult communicating with them, and also, some customers and too arrogant and ruth to the call center agent.
